verses.kjv: Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves’ eyes within thy locks: thy hair is as a flock of goats, that appear from mount Gilead.
verses.ct: Look at you — you are so beautiful, my love! You are absolutely beautiful! Your eyes behind your veil are like doves. Your hair flows like a flock of goats streaming down Mount Gilead.

verses.kjv: Thy teeth are like a flock of sheep that are even shorn, which came up from the washing; whereof every one bear twins, and none is barren among them.
verses.ct: Your teeth are like freshly shorn sheep just coming up from being washed — each one perfectly matched, not a single one missing.

verses.kjv: Thy lips are like a thread of scarlet, and thy speech is comely: thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate within thy locks.
verses.ct: Your lips are like a ribbon of scarlet, and your mouth is lovely. Your cheeks behind your veil glow like the halves of a pomegranate.

verses.kjv: Thy neck is like the tower of David builded for an armoury, whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men.
verses.ct: Your neck is like the tower of David, built as an armory, hung with 1,000 shields — all of them belonging to warriors.

verses.kjv: Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins, which feed among the lilies.
verses.ct: Your breasts are like twin fawns, a matching pair of young gazelles grazing among the lilies.

verses.kjv: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.
verses.ct: When the day dawns and the shadows disappear, I will make my way to the mountain of myrrh and the hill of frankincense.

verses.kjv: Thou art all fair, my love; there is no spot in thee.
verses.ct: Every part of you is beautiful, my love. There is not a single flaw in you.

verses.kjv: Come with me from Lebanon, my spouse, with me from Lebanon: look from the top of Amana, from the top of Shenir and Hermon, from the lions’ dens, from the mountains of the leopards.
verses.ct: Come with me from Lebanon, my bride — come with me from Lebanon! Look down from the peak of Amana, from the summit of Shenir and Hermon, from the dens where lions live, from the mountains where leopards roam.

verses.kjv: Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my spouse; thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, with one chain of thy neck.
verses.ct: You have captured my heart, my sister, my bride. You have stolen my heart with just one glance of your eyes, with a single jewel on your necklace.

verses.kjv: How fair is thy love, my sister, my spouse! how much better is thy love than wine! and the smell of thine ointments than all spices!
verses.ct: How wonderful is your love, my sister, my bride! Your love is so much better than wine, and the fragrance of your perfumes surpasses every spice!

verses.kjv: Thy lips, O my spouse, drop as the honeycomb: honey and milk are under thy tongue; and the smell of thy garments is like the smell of Lebanon.
verses.ct: Your lips drip sweetness like the honeycomb, my bride. Honey and milk rest under your tongue, and the scent of your clothing is like the fragrance of Lebanon.

verses.kjv: A garden inclosed is my sister, my spouse; a spring shut up, a fountain sealed.
verses.ct: My sister, my bride — you are a garden that is locked, a spring that is enclosed, a fountain that is sealed.

verses.kjv: Thy plants are an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; camphire, with spikenard,
verses.ct: Your branches are a paradise of pomegranates filled with delicious fruit, with henna and nard,

verses.kjv: Spikenard and saffron; calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices:
verses.ct: nard and saffron, aromatic cane and cinnamon, with every kind of frankincense tree, myrrh and aloes — every finest spice.

verses.kjv: A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon.
verses.ct: You are a garden fountain, a well of fresh flowing water, streams cascading down from Lebanon.

verses.kjv: Awake, O north wind; and come, thou south; blow upon my garden, that the spices thereof may flow out. Let my beloved come into his garden, and eat his pleasant fruits.
verses.ct: Rise up, north wind! Come, south wind! Blow through my garden so its fragrance will spread everywhere. Let my beloved come into his garden and enjoy its delicious fruit.
